info.title: Share files directly from your device
info.copyAdd: Anyone you give the link to will be able to get the files. Don't add sensitive or copyrighted files.
info.copySend: IPFS gives the files a unique fingerprint called a CID that is used to find them again on the network.
info.copyKeep: You are sharing the content from your device. Your friends can help you co-host the content by also keeping share url open in their browser.

box.runningDaemon: You need a <1>running daemon</1> to add files to IPFS.
box.configureDaemon: Make sure you <1>configure your IPFS API</1> to allow cross-origin (CORS) requests:
box.runDaemon: Then, start an IPFS daemon in your terminal:
box.footNote: If no other nodes pin your files and you stop serving them, they will disappear from the network.
box.largeFilesWarning: If you experience issues when downloading files larger than 1GB, please install <1>IPFS Desktop</1> or <3>IPFS Companion</3> for improved performance.
